properties.areaDesc: Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Southeast Aroostook; Northern Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 18 at 3:20AM EST until January 19 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Caribou ME
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind
chills as low as 34 below zero expected. For the Winter Weather
Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8
inches expected.

* WHERE...Portions of Central Highlands, Far Eastern, Far
Northern and North Woods Maine.

* WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 4 AM EST early this
morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight
to 7 PM EST Sunday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The dangerously cold wind chills could
cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. Travel
could be very difficult.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads
and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.

A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will
combine to create low wind chills. Frostbite and hypothermia can
occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and
gloves.

The latest road conditions for Maine can be obtained by going to
newengland511.org.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 7 PM EST SUNDAY
